intro: Dansiea grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered dansiea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that bear white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
